attributes.action: FORCE BUS COMPANIES TO ALLOW YOUNG PEOPLE IN FULL-TIME TO PAY ONLY HALF FARES, LIKE PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF 16!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The current (27/11/07) single fare on East Yorkshire Motor Services (EYMS) buses is £3.75 from Pocklington to York. For a 17 year old unemplyed A Level student this is too expensive. Surely people in full time education should be able to buy half fares? It is clear to me that if you are in full-time education you obviously cannot work for enough hours to have the same disposible income as someone in full-time employment, so why should you have to pay the same fare?

rejection.details: Please address the excessive use of capital letters
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
